results.idea: Competitor momentum: z-scored average one-day return of competitors
results.description: Uses rel_ret_comp (high coverage 0.8228, high user/alpha counts) as primary signal. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using the competitor return field; SUGGESTION2 not applied (no vector field identified). SUGGESTION3 not required (coverage >0.6). SUGGESTION4 followed by preferring high user/alphaCount. KEEP_IN_MIND1-4 respected: implementation short, uses 1 datafield and 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.72 because competitor-average returns historically predict cross-sectional moves but can be noisy.

results.idea: Customer sentiment sign x company size (risk-adjusted)
results.description: Combine pv13_custretsig_retsig (customer return sign, coverage 0.9276) with pv13_revere_index_cap (market cap, coverage 1.0). SUGGESTION1 applied (multiple fields). SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 not needed. Used larger userCounts. KEEP_IN_MINDs observed (<=2 datafields, short). Confidence 0.65 because sign info is binary and scaled by size may capture institutional impact.

results.idea: Network centrality momentum: PageRank of competitors trend
results.description: Use pv13_com_page_rank (high coverage 0.8966). Applied SUGGESTION1 (single strong field), SUGGESTION2 not applied (not vector). SUGGESTION3 not needed. Implementation uses ts_delta to capture short-term change. Confidence 0.60 because PageRank trend can precede flows but slower.

results.idea: Overcrowding proxy: number of competitors inverse scaled
results.description: Use rel_num_comp (coverage 0.8902, high userCount). SUGGESTION1 used single strong field; SUGGESTION3 not needed. Idea: fewer competitors -> niche -> potential outperformance. KEEP_IN_MINDs met. Confidence 0.50 conservative since structural effects are slow.

results.idea: Competitor return divergence: instrument return minus competitors' avg return
results.description: Combine rel_ret_comp with pv13_revere_index_cap to scale impact. SUGGESTION1 applied. SUGGESTION3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MINDs satisfied. Confidence 0.68 because relative performance vs peers is predictive.

results.idea: Customer return momentum: z-score of averaged customer returns
results.description: Use rel_ret_cust (coverage 0.4921) which has low coverage so applied SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill to improve coverage. SUGGESTION1 used multiple fields? only one here. SUGGESTION4 considered but rel_ret_cust has lower userCount so confidence reduced. KEEP_IN_MINDs met. Confidence 0.46 due to low coverage and counts.

results.idea: Partner flow alpha: averaged partner returns scaled by number of partners
results.description: Use rel_ret_part (coverage 0.7097) and rel_num_part (coverage 0.7837). SUGGESTION1 applied (2 fields). SUGGESTION3 not required. Preference for high user/alphaCount met. KEEP_IN_MINDs met. Confidence 0.63 as partners' performance often links to supply chain effects.

results.idea: Sector concentration: key sector count anomaly
results.description: Use pv13_revere_key_sector_total (coverage 1.0, very high userCount). SUGGESTION1 applied. No vector fields. SUGGESTION3 not needed. High confidence 0.70 because focused companies respond differently to sector moves.

results.idea: Zipcode-level momentum: country/zipcode local effect
results.description: Combine pv13_revere_zipcode (coverage 0.9238) with pv13_revere_country (coverage 1.0) to capture local clustering. SUGGESTION1 applied. No GROUP operator used to keep implementation simple per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.55 due to geographic noise.

results.idea: Authority-hub divergence: competitor authority minus hub
results.description: Use pv13_com_rk_au (authority) and pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank (hub score) both coverage ~0.8966. SUGGESTION1 applied. SUGGESTION2 not applied. Compute spread to capture structural network shifts. Confidence 0.62 because network centrality shifts can indicate competitive repositioning.

results.idea: Small-cap competitor reversal: negative competitor returns stronger for small caps
results.description: Combine rel_ret_comp and pv13_revere_index_cap. SUGGESTION1 applied. Hypothesis: small caps rebound faster when competitors fall. KEEP_IN_MINDs followed. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Product overlap momentum: instrument relative to overlapping companies
results.description: Use rel_ret_all (high coverage 0.9613) and rel_num_all. SUGGESTION1 applied. No ts_backfill needed. Confidence 0.67 since product-overlap peers drive demand shocks.

results.idea: Competitor return IR (stability): ts_ir of competitor returns
results.description: Use rel_ret_comp and ts_ir to measure consistency of competitor returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. SUGGESTION4 satisfied. KEEP_IN_MINDs kept. Confidence 0.61 because stable competitor trends imply persistent pressures.

results.idea: Customer return sign persistence: days since last customer sign change
results.description: Use pv13_custretsig_retsig; compute days_from_last_change to capture persistent positive/negative customer flow. SUGGESTION3 not needed. Simple implementation per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Competitor count growth: recent increase in number of competitors
results.description: Use rel_num_comp with ts_delta to detect entry/exit changes. SUGGESTION1 applied. SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence 0.54 as competitor entry often pressures margins.

results.idea: Market-cap normalized PageRank: page rank divided by size
results.description: Combine pv13_com_page_rank with pv13_revere_index_cap. SUGGESTION1 applied. Dividing centrality by size highlights influential small firms. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Sector terminal focus anomaly: terminal sector count z-score
results.description: Use pv13_revere_term_sector_total (coverage 1.0). SUGGESTION1 applied. Terminal-sector counts indicate niche concentration. KEEP_IN_MINDs met. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Customer vs competitor divergence: customers up while competitors down
results.description: Use rel_ret_cust (low coverage) backfilled and rel_ret_comp. Applied SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill to rel_ret_cust. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence 0.57 given mixed coverage.

results.idea: Partner return momentum scaled by partner count stability
results.description: Use rel_ret_part and ts_count_nans on rel_num_part to gauge stability; SUGGESTION1 applied. KEEP_IN_MINDs kept. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: High PageRank competitor spikes: detect recent spikes in competitor PageRank
results.description: pv13_com_page_rank used with ts_arg_max to find recent maxima. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.6 because spikes may reflect shifting influence.

results.idea: Low competition contrarian: instruments with high returns and few competitors
results.description: Combine ts_returns (instrument proxy pv13_revere_index_value) and rel_num_comp. SUGGESTION1 applied. KEEP_IN_MINDs followed. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Customers leading indicator: recent customer PageRank changes
results.description: Use pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank (coverage 0.7906) to detect shifts in customer influence; SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Competitor return volatility: ts_std_dev of competitor returns
results.description: Use rel_ret_comp with ts_std_dev to capture dispersion. SUGGESTION1 applied. High userCount field chosen. Confidence 0.60 as volatility often predicts future risk-adjusted returns.

results.idea: Overlapping product concentration: fewer overlapping companies with high returns
results.description: Combine rel_num_all (coverage 0.9939) and rel_ret_all. SUGGESTION1 applied. Score rewards high product-overlap returns when few overlaps. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Competitor return rank mean reversion
results.description: Use quantile(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,5)) to rank competitor returns cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Network centrality dispersion: stddev of competitor PageRank
results.description: Use vec_stddev if competitor PageRank available as vector; otherwise use ts_std_dev. SUGGESTION2 not applied (vector not confirmed). Chosen ts_std_dev of pv13_com_page_rank. Confidence 0.51.

results.idea: Customer sign momentum scaled by market cap
results.description: Combine pv13_custretsig_retsig and pv13_revere_index_cap; SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: High-authority competitors with falling returns (short signal)
results.description: Combine pv13_com_rk_au and ts_delta(rel_ret_comp,3). SUGGESTION1 applied. Hypothesis: authoritative competitors declining indicates sector weakness. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: New competitor arrival detection via kth_element
results.description: Use kth_element on rel_num_comp to backfill first valid count change (k=1). SUGGESTION3 applied to fill sparse entries. Keeps implementation short. Confidence 0.48 as entries are noisy.

results.idea: Partner return information ratio
results.description: Compute ts_ir on rel_ret_part. SUGGESTION1 used single strong field. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Competitor return kurtosis for tail-risk signal
results.description: Use ts_kurtosis(rel_ret_comp, 60) to detect fat tails in peer returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.50; kurtosis tends to be noisy.

results.idea: Sector-level size-adjusted return: sector index value vs cap
results.description: pv13_revere_index_value and pv13_revere_index_cap combined to get value per cap ratio. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Competing authorities mean reversion
results.description: Use pv13_com_rk_au and ts_mean to capture slow mean reversion in authority scores. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Local market saturation: primary sector focused company count inverse
results.description: primary_sector_focused_company_count has low coverage (0.3508) so applied ts_backfill. SUGGESTION3 used. SUGGESTION4 less applicable due to low userCount. Confidence 0.40 conservative.

results.idea: High customer PageRank with rising returns
results.description: Combine pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank and rel_ret_cust (backfilled). SUGGESTION3 applied to rel_ret_cust. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Competition-adjusted return momentum
results.description: Instrument short-term returns (pv13_revere_index_value) adjusted by rival mean return rel_ret_comp. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Product overlap density: number of overlapping companies trend
results.description: Use rel_num_all with ts_delta to spot rising competitor density. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.49.

results.idea: Competitor PageRank to customer PageRank ratio
results.description: Combine pv13_com_page_rank and pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank to see mismatch between competitive and customer centrality. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Sparse-customer alert: rel_num_cust backfilled inverse
results.description: rel_num_cust has coverage 0.5068 so apply ts_backfill to reduce sparsity per SUGGESTION3. Use inverse to highlight firms with few customers. Confidence 0.45.

results.idea: Competitor return lead-lag: ts_corr between instrument and competitor returns
results.description: Use ts_corr(pv13_revere_index_value, ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,3), 20). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.60 because correlation structure can reveal leaders/laggers.

results.idea: Network hub spike preceded returns
results.description: pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank ts_arg_max to detect recent hub changes in customers and relate to future returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Competition-adjusted volatility breakout
results.description: Compare ts_std_dev of instrument (pv13_revere_index_value) vs competitors ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp). SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: PageRank-weighted competitor returns
results.description: Weight rel_ret_comp by pv13_com_page_rank to emphasize influential competitors. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Sector-level entropy: key sector total inverse times returns
results.description: Use pv13_revere_key_sector_total to proxy diversification; combine with sector return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Competitor count volatility (entry/exit detection)
results.description: ts_std_dev(rel_num_comp, 60) to find groups with unstable competition. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.47.

results.idea: Customers' PageRank mean reversion
results.description: ts_zscore(ts_mean(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank,30),60). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.50.

results.idea: Competitor influence growth: change in competitor hub rank
results.description: Use ts_delta on pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank (coverage ~0.8966). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Customer-influenced reversal: instrument returns opposite to customer returns
results.description: Subtract ts_mean(rel_ret_cust,5) from ts_returns(pv13_revere_index_value) with rel_ret_cust backfilled. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Competitor authority-weighted dispersion
results.description: Use pv13_com_rk_au and vec_range if competitor authorities provided as vector; otherwise compute ts_max - ts_min across time. SUGGESTION2 not applied due to no vector. Confidence 0.48.

results.idea: Partner count scaled momentum
results.description: Combine rel_num_part with ts_returns of instrument; SUGGESTION1 applied. More partners -> network effects stronger. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: High terminal-sector concentration momentum
results.description: Use pv13_revere_term (coverage 0.4115) backfilled with ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3, then zscore. Confidence 0.42 due to low coverage.

results.idea: Competition return product: identify simultaneous competitor moves
results.description: Use ts_product(rel_ret_comp,5) to find days when many competitors move in same direction. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Customer hub-authority mismatch signal
results.description: Divide pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank by pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank to detect structural customer network changes. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Competition-adjusted zscore of returns per product overlap
results.description: Use rel_ret_all and rel_num_all to create normalized return per overlapping company. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Size-normalized competitor IR
results.description: Compute ts_ir(rel_ret_comp,60) divided by pv13_revere_index_cap to emphasize small firms with stable competitor signals. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Competitor returns quantile trend
results.description: Use ts_quantile(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,5),7) to get smoothed rank of competitor returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Customer count growth vs competitor count growth divergence
results.description: Compare ts_delta(rel_num_cust,30) (backfilled) with ts_delta(rel_num_comp,30). Applied SUGGESTION3 for rel_num_cust. Confidence 0.50.

results.idea: High PageRank competitors with low number of partners (idiosyncratic influence)
results.description: Combine pv13_com_page_rank and rel_num_part. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Competitor returns short-term reversal detection
results.description: Use ts_rank or ts_arg_min/arg_max of rel_ret_comp; here use ts_arg_min to find recent minima. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Weighted customer returns by customer PageRank
results.description: Multiply rel_ret_cust (backfilled) by pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: Competitor authority z-score times partner count
results.description: Multiply ts_zscore(pv13_com_rk_au,30) by rel_num_part to capture networked competitive influence. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Customer return streak detection using ts_step & ts_returns
results.description: Use ts_returns on pv13_revere_index_value then ts_step to measure continuous streaks; SUGGESTION1 applied. KEEP_IN_MINDs kept short. Confidence 0.49.

results.idea: High competitor mean return with low dispersion (consensus signal)
results.description: Combine ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,5) and ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp,5) via divide; SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Product overlap weighted PageRank
results.description: Multiply rel_num_all and pv13_com_page_rank to emphasize PageRank when product overlap is high. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Country-level cap normalization
results.description: Normalize pv13_revere_index_cap by pv13_revere_country via divide to detect over/under-sized companies by country. SUGGESTION1 applied. KEEP_IN_MIND2 satisfied. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Competitor return decay (ts_decay_linear approximation via ts_zscore of lagged returns)
results.description: Approximate decaying influence with ts_zscore(ts_delta(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,5),3),20). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: High-authority customers with few overlaps (niche powerful customers)
results.description: Divide pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank by rel_num_all. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.51.

results.idea: Competition-adjusted return zscore by sector level
results.description: Use pv13_revere_level (coverage 0.6205) available; apply ts_zscore on rel_ret_comp grouped by level conceptually but implement simple division to respect KEEP_IN_MIND. SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence 0.48.

results.idea: Partner returns mean reversion signal
results.description: ts_arg_max of rel_ret_part to detect recent peaks suggests reversion. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.50.

results.idea: Competitor return lead indicator: ts_regression slope vs instrument returns
results.description: Use ts_regression(rel_ret_comp, pv13_revere_index_value, 60) to estimate slope. SUGGESTION1 applied. KEEP_IN_MIND kept concise. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Company centrality vs sector terminality
results.description: Multiply pv13_com_page_rank by pv13_revere_term_sector_total to find influential firms in terminal sectors. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Customer count stability: ts_count_nans on rel_num_cust
results.description: rel_num_cust low coverage so apply ts_count_nans with backfill; SUGGESTION3 used to mitigate sparsity. Confidence 0.44.

results.idea: Competition-weighted volatility suppression (buy low volatility competitors)
results.description: Divide instrument volatility by competitor volatility: subtract ts_std_dev(pv13_revere_index_value,30) - ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp,30). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: PageRank momentum cross-sectionally (quantile of pv13_com_page_rank)
results.description: Use quantile(pv13_com_page_rank) to get cross-sectional extremeness. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Competitor return tail event detector using ts_max_diff
results.description: ts_max_diff(rel_ret_comp, 20) flags recent drops relative to recent max. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Customers leading competitors: lead correlation
results.description: ts_corr(ts_mean(rel_ret_cust,3), ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,3), 20) with rel_ret_cust backfilled per SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.51.

results.idea: Small cluster alpha: instruments with few competitors but high PageRank
results.description: Divide pv13_com_page_rank by rel_num_comp to highlight influential niche firms. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Partner-customer divergence: rel_ret_part - rel_ret_cust
results.description: Use rel_ret_part and rel_ret_cust (backfilled). SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.50 as signals can cancel.

results.idea: Industry-level concentration decline (primary sector focused company count change)
results.description: primary_sector_focused_company_count has low coverage so ts_backfill applied. Use ts_delta to detect declines. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.41.

results.idea: Competitor returns escalator: cumulative sum of short-term returns
results.description: Use ts_sum(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,1),5) to capture recent cumulative move. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: PageRank normalized by sector size
results.description: Divide pv13_com_page_rank by pv13_revere_company_total (low coverage 0.3508) with ts_backfill applied. SUGGESTION3 used. Confidence 0.47.

results.idea: Competitor authority momentum vs instrument returns
results.description: ts_corr(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,5), pv13_com_rk_au, 30) to find alignment. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Customer PageRank zscore times instrument returns
results.description: Multiply ts_zscore(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank,30) by ts_returns(pv13_revere_index_value,5). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Relatively isolated firms: low rel_num_all with rising customer influence
results.description: Combine inverse(rel_num_all) and pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Competitor consensus breakdown: high std dev but high mean (divergent views)
results.description: Use ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,5) and ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp,5) to flag conflicts. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Customer vs partner return alignment score
results.description: ts_corr(ts_mean(rel_ret_cust,5), ts_mean(rel_ret_part,5), 30) with rel_ret_cust backfilled. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.49.

results.idea: Competitor authority to PageRank ratio
results.description: Divide pv13_com_rk_au by pv13_com_page_rank to highlight structural differences. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Sector-level index value momentum normalized by key sector count
results.description: Divide ts_returns(pv13_revere_index_value,5) by pv13_revere_key_sector_total. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Competitor return rank cross-sectional zscore
results.description: zscore(ts_rank(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,5), 5)) to detect relative outliers. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Partner PageRank influence: partner count weighted hub score
results.description: Multiply rel_num_part by pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank to detect partner-network strength. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.51.

results.idea: Competitor return smoothed momentum (ts_decay_linear proxy)
results.description: Use ts_zscore(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,3), 30) as smoothed momentum. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: High PageRank competitors with low competition growth
results.description: Combine pv13_com_page_rank and negative ts_delta(rel_num_comp,30). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Customer return sign consistency: ts_count_nans on cust sign changes
results.description: Use ts_count_nans on pv13_custretsig_retsig to measure sign stability; SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.47.

results.idea: Competition pressure index: rel_num_comp times ts_std_dev of competitor returns
results.description: Multiply rel_num_comp by ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp,30) to measure pressure. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Customers leading returns: ts_arg_max of backfilled rel_ret_cust vs instrument
results.description: Use ts_arg_max(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,60), 10). SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Competitor return shock detector: ts_max_diff on rel_ret_comp
results.description: ts_max_diff(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,1), 10) to detect sudden drops relative to max. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: PageRank mean reversion scaled by company count
results.description: Divide ts_zscore(ts_mean(pv13_com_page_rank,30),60) by ts_backfill(pv13_revere_company_total,90) since company_total low coverage. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.46.

results.idea: Partner-influenced sector alpha: rel_num_part normalized by sector key count
results.description: Divide rel_num_part by pv13_revere_key_sector_total to find over-networked firms in small sector context. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Competitor returns momentum-times-authority
results.description: Multiply ts_zscore(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,5),20) by pv13_com_rk_au to emphasize moves from authoritative peers. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Customer hub spikes preceding local outperformance
results.description: ts_arg_max on pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank followed by instrument returns check; SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.51.

results.idea: Competition-adjusted return zscore by company total
results.description: Divide ts_zscore(ts_returns(pv13_revere_index_value,5),20) by ts_backfill(pv13_revere_company_total,90). SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.49.
